stop.name: Full stop
stop.ex: Móonə á tə́ noŋnə̂ á əkwunə́
stop.meaning: the baby is lying on the bed
stop.desc: The full stop (.) in Awing marks the end of a declarative sentence.

question.name: Question mark
question.desc: The question mark (?) marks the end of a interrogative sentence.

exclamation.name: Exclamation mark
exclamation.desc: The exclamation mark (?) is written at the end of a command, or it is placed following exclamatory words or phrases.

comma.name: Comma
comma.ex: BPó mǎ ńgyǐəə lə́ ə́fɛ̂, pó ghɛnə̂ lə́
comma.breakdown: 3p NEG come to here, 3p go to stream
comma.meaning: They are not coming here, they are going to the stream
comma.desc: The comma (,) is used to seperate clauses or parallel words within a clause as shown below.

colon.name: Quotation marks
colon.ex: Máma a tə́ ḿbɪ́tə ńgə́, "Gho ghɛnə̂ lə́ ə́fó?"
colon.breakdown: grandmother 3s PROG ask COMP, 2s go to where
colon.meaning: Mama (grandmother) is asking, "Where are you going?"
colon.desc: They occur at the beginning and the end of direct speech

quotation.name: Parentheses
quotation.ex: Wù fiìnè nyám sə́ (bvə́y sibaà wùn à njiì).
quotation.breakdown: he sell animals his goat two and with sheep
quotation.meaning: He sold animals (two goats and a sheep).
quotation.desc: Parentheses (brackets) are used to insert background information into a text as shown below.

capital.name: Capitalisation
capital.desc: Capital letters are used at the beginning of sentences, for proper nouns, and sometimes after a colon.
